bestBHT.bht: If you are not under the dominion of your own renewed mind and influenced by the meek, pure, and holy spirit of the Lord Jesus, then you are not in the spirit and belong not to Christ. The dwelling of the Spirit of God in you indicates a mystical union with Christ in the Holy Spirit and serves as evidence that you are a child of God. It is a sharp and solemn statement: if any man does not have the Spirit of Christ, he is none of His.

Henry Alford: But (opposition to they that are in the flesh) ye are not in the flesh...but in the Spirit, if...the Spirit of God dwelleth in you."
if any man hath not the Spirit of Christ, he is none of His.
Observe here that the expressions 'the Spirit of God,' 'the Spirit of Christ,' and 'Christ,' are all used of the Holy Spirit indwelling in the Christian.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: It thus appears that to be 'in the spirit' means here to be under the dominion of our own renewed mind because the indwelling of God's Spirit is given as the evidence that we are 'in the spirit'."
Again, this does not mean 'the disposition or mind of Christ,' but the Holy Ghost; here called 'the Spirit of Christ'..."
Albert Barnes: Not in the flesh - Not under the full influence of corrupt desires and passions.
The expression, to dwell in one, denotes intimacy of connection, and means that those things which are the fruits of the Spirit are produced in the heart.
If a man is not influenced by the meek, pure, and holy spirit of the Lord Jesus, if he is not conformed to his image, if his life does not resemble that of the Saviour, he is a stranger to religion.
John Calvin: It is the surest mark by which the children of God are distinguished from the children of the world, when by the Spirit of God they are renewed unto purity and holiness.

Nor are they yet said to be according to the Spirit, because they are filled with God’s Spirit, but because they have the Spirit dwelling in them, though they find some remains of the flesh still remaining in them.
Those in whom the Spirit reigns not, belong not to Christ; then they are not Christians who serve the flesh; for they who separate Christ from his own Spirit make him like a dead image or a carcase.
Philip Schaff: The Spirit of God dwell in you. In the previous clause the ‘Spirit’ is represented as the element in which they live; here as the indwelling power which enables them to live in this element.
'In you' must not be weakened into 'among you.'
It means the Holy Spirit which belongs to, or proceeds from, Christ, this designation Ming adopted to prove the truth that those who have not this Spirit are 'none of Christ’s.'
Archibald T. Robertson: Not in the flesh... but in the spirit."
The mystical union of the believer with Christ in the Holy Spirit.
Incidental argument for the Deity of Christ.
John Gill: The inhabitation of the Spirit is a distinguishing character of a regenerate man; which is to be understood not of his omnipresence, nor of a participation of his gifts, whether ordinary or extraordinary: nor does the Spirit of God only dwell in his people by his graces, but in person as in office, and in a way of special favour...

This is owing not to any goodness in them, or to any fitness and preparations of theirs to receive him; but to a federal union to Christ and relation to him, to our Lord's ascension and intercession, and to the love and grace of the Father...
By 'the Spirit of Christ', is not meant the human soul of Christ; nor his divine nature; nor his Gospel, which is the Spirit that gives life; but the Holy Ghost, the third person in the Trinity...
John Wesley: If any man have not the Spirit of Christ — Dwelling and governing in him.
He is none of his — He is not a member of Christ; not a Christian; not in a state of salvation.
A plain, express declaration, which admits of no exception. He that hath ears to hear, let him hear!

bhtAttempts.bht: If you are not under the dominion of your own renewed mind and influenced by the meek, pure, and holy spirit of the Lord Jesus, then you are not in the spirit and belong not to Christ. The dwelling of the Spirit of God in you indicates a mystical union with Christ in the Holy Spirit and serves as evidence that you are a child of God. It is a sharp and solemn statement; if any man does not have the Spirit of Christ, he is none of His. This verse also incidentally argues for the Deity of Christ and emphasizes the importance of the Holy Spirit's indwelling in the life of a believer.

To be in the spirit means to be under the dominion of your renewed mind, influenced by the meek, pure, and holy spirit of the Lord Jesus. The dwelling of the Spirit of God in you is the evidence of your mystical union with Christ in the Holy Spirit. It is a sharp and solemn statement: if any man does not have the Spirit of Christ, he does not belong to Him. This emphasizes the significance of the Holy Spirit's indwelling in the life of a believer, solidifying their identity as a child of God.

If you are not under the dominion of your own renewed mind and influenced by the meek, pure, and holy spirit of the Lord Jesus, then you are not in the spirit and belong not to Christ. The dwelling of the Spirit of God in you indicates a mystical union with Christ in the Holy Spirit and serves as evidence that you are a child of God. It is a sharp and solemn statement: if any man does not have the Spirit of Christ, he is none of His.
